member_organisations: ACC is a global bar association membership of approximately 42.000 in-house counsel who work for corporations, associations and other private-sector organizations.  For more information on membership eligibility, please see: https://www.acc.com/membership/eligibility.cfm
fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Trade, Competition, Employment and Social Affairs, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: ACC is working to get the issue of legal professional privilege (LPP) for in-house counsel addressed at the EU level, so that in-house counsel of EU member states exercise the same rights as outside counsel in proceedings before the European Commission. We track the following EU initiative, policies and legislative files: general and institutional matters; employment and social affairs; single market; trade; justice and fundamental rights; taxation; companies; competition; financial services.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
position: Director of Public Policy and Advocacy
legal_status: Not for profit corporation incorporated in Washington, DC, USA
goals__remit: The Association of Corporate Counsel (ACC) is a global bar association that promotes the common professional and business interests of in-house counsel who work for corporations, associations and other private-sector organizations through information, education, networking opportunities and advocacy initiatives. ACC's advocacy initiatives aim to raise the status of in-house counsel within the legal profession and address legal issues where in-house counsel have a unique perspective.
